articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: The just ended European Championships in Hungary didn’t just give us three exciting and tough races. We also found out who has the best chances to win the 2024 Orienteering World Cup, which will be decided in Finland at the World Cup final in September. In the men’s category, Kasper Fosser (NOR) took a big […]
articles.title: World Cup: Fosser takes over lead after EOC, Aebersold remains on top

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: Norway’s men defended their relay title and Switzerland took the women’s gold when the European Orienteering Championships came to an end on Tuesday afternoon. It was another warm day in central Hungary with 33 degrees and another day with a lot of slope orienteering. Not as many rock details compared to the weekend races, but […]
articles.title: EOC: Norway defends men’s relay title, Switzerland wins women’s race

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: A number of future international championships found their home, when the IOF Council met during World Orienteering Championships in Edinburgh in July. Here, the Council appointed Spain as the host of WOC 2028, which is a Sprint WOC. The 2028 World Orienteering Championship is set to take place in Girona, located in the north-eastern corner […]
articles.title: WOC 2028 in Spain, WTMBOC 2026 to Sweden and EOC 2026 in Lithuania

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: Two of orienteering’s biggest names, Tove Alexandersson (SWE) and Kasper Fosser (NOR) convincingly won the long distance at the European Championships in Hungary. After Saturday’s tough Middle final, it was time to saddle up again on Sunday morning and re-visit the steep slopes and many rock details for the Long distance. The same arena was […]
articles.title: EOC: Clear long distance wins for Alexandersson and Fosser

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: Norway’s Eirik Langedal Breivik caught the entire orienteering world by surprise by winning and Simona Aebersold (SUI) defended her Middle distance title as the first final at European Orienteering Championships took place on Saturday afternoon. Technically demandng courses on the big, stony slopes in the central Hungarian terrain created major challenges and many decisive losses […]
articles.title: EOC: Norwegian surprise and Swiss title defence on Middle distance

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: The more than 300 athletes competing at the European Orienteering Championships got their first real taste of the continental terrain in central Hungary on Friday morning, when the Middle distance qualification took place. Divided into three heats for each gender, the task was clear: A top 20 position in the massive Hungarian August heat earned […]
articles.title: EOC 2024: Warm Middle qualification kicked off the championships

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: In the coming days, the new European champions of Orienteering will be crowned in Hungary, and you are invited to follow closely. The three final races that also count in the 2024 Orienteering World Cup: Middle (Saturday), Long (Sunday) and Relay (Tuesday) can be followed through a high-quality TV production on IOF TV and a […]
articles.title: How to follow EOC and World Cup in Hungary

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: At the European Orienteering Championships and World Cup Round 3 in Hungary, our partner CX80 will have its own stand. This event will offer an opportunity for attendees to engage with one of the leading brands in the industry and to try out a range of high-quality technical products designed for daily life and for […]
articles.title: CX80 to host exclusive stand at EOC in Hungary

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: The world’s best orienteers return to the forest, when the 2024 European Orienteering Championships begin in Hungary on Friday. Exactly one month after the World Orienteering Championships ended with an exhilarating Knock-Out Sprint on the hard surfaces of Edinburgh, the EOC kicks off with the middle distance qualification in the challenging, hilly terrain of central […]
articles.title: Warm and tough EOC to begin on Friday

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: World Masters Orienteering Championships 2024 came to an end on Friday, when the Long distance concluded the WMOC-week in Finland. The athletes competed west of Turku in the Finnish archipelagoes in relatively open and rocky terrain. That suited the home nation well, as Finland was the most successful nation with 12 golds on Friday. Sweden […]
articles.title: WMOC Long: 12 golds for Finland on final day

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: More than 400 masters athletes are racing for World Masters MTBO titles at WMMTBOC in Viborg, Denmark this week. Four races: Mass start, Middle, Sprint and Long will take the athletes to some of the finest MTBO terrains in Jutland in western Denmark, among them Ebeltoft and Undallslund plantations, which were also used for the […]
articles.title: World Masters MTBO Championships well underway in Denmark

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: The athletes at the World Masters Orienteering Championships in Finland were met with challenging courses at the middle distance final on Wednesday. The more than 3,700 participants were just like at Tuesday’s forest qualification in the forests at Sauvo east of the host city Turku. Today’s terrain was full of details with very few paths […]
articles.title: WMOC Middle: Demanding terrain for Wednesday’s final

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: The biennial North American Orienteering Championships start this Tuesday in Canada’s Ontario region and feature five championship races over the coming days. The first race is the individual sprint, then there’s a Sprint Relay on Wednesday before Thursday’s Knock-Out Sprint concludes the sprint races, all taking place in the city of Kingston, Ontario. Here the […]
articles.title: North America crowns its champions this week in Ontario

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: More than 3,200 masters athletes took part when the first final at the World Masters Orienteering Championships in Finland was run on Sunday. The sprint final took place in central Turku, the host of city the championships, which featured challenging courses with plenty of demanding short leg in a mix of parkland and hard surfaces […]
articles.title: WMOC: Challenging sprint final in Turku

articles.author: Erling Thisted
articles.description: The 2024 World Masters Orienteering Championships have attracted more than 4,200 competitors to the south-west corner of Finland, where the competitions begin on Saturday with the sprint qualification race. 42 nations are represented at the championships, where world masters champions will be crowned in 25 classes from W/M 35 up to W95 and M90. The […]
articles.title: WMOC to start in Finland with 4000+ participants

articles.author: Jan Kocbach
articles.description: Norway’s men and Switzerland’s women won the European Orienteering Championships (EOC) relay in Hungary. Silver and bronze went to Sweden and Switzerland in the men’s class, while Norway and Sweden took the remaining medals in the women’s class. After very technical orienteering on the middle distance and tricky routechoices on the long distance, the relay was ...
articles.title: EOC 2024 Relay: Analysis, Maps and Results

articles.author: Jan Kocbach
articles.description: The big favourites Kasper Fosser (Norway) and Tove Alexandersson (Sweden) took clear victories at the European Orienteering Championships (EOC) Long distance in Hungary – both with a margin of around 4 minutes to their closest competitors. In the men’s class Daniel Hubmann (Switzerland) took an impressive silver medal – 18 years after he took his ...
articles.title: EOC 2024 Long: Analysis, Maps and Results

articles.author: Jan Kocbach
articles.description: Eirik Langedal Breivik (Norway) and Simona Aebersold (Switzerland) won the European Orienteering Championships (EOC) Middle on very technical, Hungarian terrain that really challenged the runners. We saw big mistakes by many athletes, with Breivik and Aebersold managing to navigate well in the steep hills while keeping high speed. In the men’s class Kasper Fosser (Norway) ...
articles.title: EOC 2024 Middle: Analysis, Maps and Results

articles.author: Jan Kocbach
articles.description: Challenging forest terrain, interesting routechoices and high temperatures await as European Orienteering Championships (EOC) start in Hungary on Friday with Middle Qualification. The championships continue with Middle Final on Saturday, Long on Sunday and finishes off with the Relay on Tuesday. The world’s top orienteers return to the forest when the 2024 European Orienteering Championships ...
articles.title: EOC 2024: All You Need To Know

articles.description:
WUOC was a fun-spirited event designed for university students, but the competition was very fierce, with a large number of WOC-level runners. The team felt it was refreshing to race against athletes who were also students, as opposed to the full-time professionals seen in the World Cup and WOC. Unfortunately, some team members faced illness and […]

The warm-up events on the 18th and 19th are just outside New Plymouth, Taranaki, which is about half-way between Auckland and Wellington. Driving time is approximately 4.5 hours from either end, and domestic flights to New Plymouth airport take about one hour. After you’ve warmed up on Taranaki’s middle and long distance, it’s another 3 hours’ […]

articles.description:
Bring your bike and allow time arrive in the South Island way before Nationals because the MTBO nationals is planned for the weekend before Easter. The format will roughly be:  Alexandra for the middle, the sprint on Saturday, at Naseby for long on Sunday  and a Rogaine on Monday.

articles.author: Christo Peters
articles.description:
The protégé effect is a learning phenomenon where teaching and preparing to teach information to others helps a person learn that information. Jakob has fast tracked his knowledge of orienteering super-fast by growing his knowledge as he introduces the sport to others in the community.  Jakob Abernethy began orienteering three years ago in Year 8, inspired by […]
Jakob’s journey aligns with acceleration of the sport first appeared on Orienteering New Zealand.
articles.title: Jakob’s journey aligns with acceleration of the sport

articles.description:
On August 2nd, the Red Kiwi Orienteering Club hosted the second Manawatū Schools’ Relay Championships. This year, we saw participation from 246 students across 25 schools, marking an increase of 60 students and 6 new schools from last year. Leading up to the event, club members visited interested schools to teach orienteering skills through classroom […]

Orienteering is known to enhance brain health and longevity. Rob Garden tested the new knee by pushing hard on the pedals during the Masters MTBO. Meanwhile, Marquita consistently earned the second spot at the World Masters MTBO Championships and is very motivated to return to claim a top position next year. Rob and Marquita rode their […]

he September edition of The Australian Orienteer magazine is in press, and is available online. The magazine includes many reports from local and international orienteering events, a preview of all the teams heading to the Australian Schools Orienteering Championships and the Southern Cross Junior Challenge (see page 36, pictured here for the NZ teams), plus tips for MTBO beginners.
